headline: Tater Tots Casserole
description: This version of the classic casserole using Tater Tots® has layers of potatoes, cheese, and ground beef for a savory, comfort-food classic.

video.description: A very comforting and delicious casserole for the whole family!
video.name: Tater Tots® Casserole

name: Tater Tots Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (32 ounce) package frozen bite-size potato nuggets (such as Tater Tots®), divided
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare a 13x9-inch casserole dish with cooking spray.
Spread 20 potato nuggets in the casserole dish.
Bake in preheated oven until warmed through, about 10 minutes.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef and onion in the hot skillet until beef is completely browned, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease. Season beef mixture with 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce, steak seasoning, garlic powder, and black pepper.
Stir cream of mushroom soup, milk, 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese, and 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce together in a bowl.

Smash the warmed potato nuggets in the casserole dish to cover the bottom completely. Spread ground beef mixture over the mashed potato nuggets. Pour soup mixture evenly over the beef layer. Top with remaining potato nuggets and sprinkle 1 cup Cheddar cheese evenly over the nuggets.
Bake in preheated oven until casserole is bubbly and potatoes golden brown, 30 to 40 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Made this tonight, it was good. Served with a salad. Not something I would make often, but occasionally when I just want meat and potatoes.

I've made variations of this but I am going to try this exactly as it shows to see if we like it. I have never added worcestershire sauce to this before or the Montreal seasoning like it shows. Also the layering is a bit different than I have done before. Looking forward to trying this tonight! Thank you for the recipe. I love using this site for new ideas.
Very tasty and easy to make. My family loved it and would make it again.
I made it exactly as written, and included the Montreal steak seasoning, and we loved it!! It was perfect, and I plan to make it again this weekend!!
Great meal
Filling. Not much taste and bad consistency. I will not make this again.
I added two cups thawed mixed veggies to the beef mixture for a complete meal. My family favorite!
Very good. One of the better tater tot casseroles I have made.
Try using Johnsoville hot italian loose sausage instead of ground beef, its fantastic
I made this tonight for dinner and it was delicious. Followed the recipe as is. Wouldn't change a thing.
OK, not amazing. Made as directed, including the Montreal Steak seasoning.

My family all enjoyed this recipe. I actually doubled it but had to use cream of chicken soup instead of mushroom soup. This dish was creamy and not dry at all. This dish was very filling for four adults with leftovers for lunch tomorrow!
This is JUST what I needed today! Used white cheddar for looks. Used Impossible Ground because I can’t eat meat. So, so good.

I always make the recipe as shown for the first time & I did in this instance, however, I liked the post from EAM way back in 2016 & decided to try it that way and keeping all ingredients the same. This was a hit. Top layer of tots was crunchy, the way we like it. Thanks for recipe!

I liked this recipe. I particularly liked the suggestion to preheat and then smash some of the tater tots on the bottom. I did substitute some sour cream for some milk and went real easy on the garlic (It doesn't like me!). I think next time I will add another can of soup - probably cream of celery. I'd like it to be a bit more moist but it was very tasty.

First time I tried tater tot casserole w/ taters on the bottom and it’s excellent. I subbed a lot of things (ground turkey, cream of chicken, and lawery’s seasoning salt), but used the same measurements/amounts and did not find it soupy at all. Lastly, I added corn on top of the soup/milk mixture... and again, the addition did not make it soupy. I’m not sure what happened to those who did have a soupy casserole. Anyway, will continue to build my tater tot casserole like this and refer to this recipe- adjusting to taste/what I have on hand.

This was so easy and sooooo good! I had thawed 1.5 lbs of ground beef earlier in the day so that’s what I used instead of the 1 lb the recipe called for. Other than that, I followed the recipe exactly. Entire family loved it. Next time I’m going to try it with ground turkey to make it a little less fattening.
Very good! Reading th other reviews of it being a bit “soggy”, I used whole hash browns to line the bottom with, then also added a can of corn and I’m glad I did. Delish!
Not sure what sized nugget they used, needed 40 to cover the bottom and that wasn't even completely.
Made exactly as recipe stated....Very flavorful....It is not too sloopy as some commenters have said....It does not call for the dish to being covered while baking....That may be the reason
This is yummy! Use the Montreal steak seasoning, it sets it apart from the other tater tot casserole recipes.
Easy and good!!!
Taste great no changes made and still love it will recommend
I had to make it gluten free, so I made my own cream soup. I used about 35 tater tots for bottom crust. It was good, and I will make it again but probably will buy some canned gluten free cream soup.
I made this with ground Turkey but otherwise followed the recipe. It reminded me of my grandmother’s cooking and I loved it!

Made as directed with the exception of cooking. The flavour was great and really enjoyed it. For the last 5 minutes I put the dish under the broiler without the cheese to crisp up the potatoes. I then added the cheese and placed it back under for about 2 minutes. I appreciated the crunchy texture. I also used an 8x11 baking dish and glad I did. A 9x13 would have thinned out the dish too much.
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE! I (of course) adjusted as necessary for my oven and personal tastes, but not much.

I just had this casserole for dinner tonight and I loved it. I can't believe I was out of garlic powder so I chopped up 2 large cloves of garlic and cooked them with the beef and onions. The only ingredient I measured was the milk. Having spent my first 21 years in Wisconsin I am definitely a cheese addict. I used two kinds of smoked cheddar cheese. Looking forward to making this again.
This is my first time making this recipe and I followed the recipe verbatim except for adding pepper. The steak seasoning seems to have plenty in it.
This was delicious! The only thing I did differently was use Seasonall because I didn't have any Montreal Seasoning. I have already bought the tater tots to make it again.
I REALLY wanted to like this recipe. Very bland, won’t make again.

This was a good recipe that I'll make again. I followed directions and ingredients as written.

 It is a bit one dimensional, on the savory side, probably great for the kids but I will probably add something to brighten it up just a bit and give it some texture, maybe some corn or chopped broccoli, perhaps even some chopped green olives, something to add just a bit of acidity to cut through the richness. However, this is a great base recipe and a wonderful starting point if you'd like to add your own touch.
I love this recipe it's a family favorite

This was such yumminess! I forgot to save, lost it and ended up since making two seperate recipes in search of this, EPIC failures!!! BINGO, I found you again. Will return with pics when I do this beauty again. 
Thank you.
Just made this for the family they loved it! very easy! who doesn't like tater tots!!

I did alter this recipe a bit, I sprayed the bottom of the pan with cooking spray, hoping to make tots a little crispier & I substituted Alfredo sauce for the cream of mushroom soup & milk cause I had a jar I needed to use up. I also added some fresh mushrooms when cooking meat. It was a hit with my husband & will definitely make again.
Added corn and green beans.
It was quick, easy and delicious! I made it with ground turkey and I added frozen green beans. So yummy!!

I know it's not right to review a recipe not exactly followed, but I had to share a comment. This is a very versatile recipe. Any meat...pork, chicken, turkey can be used. I had some leftover pork roast that I ground up. I did add some chopped garlic to the sauted onion rather than garlic powder. Didn't have cream of mushroom but had cream of chicken soup. I increased the milk to 3/4 cup because we like things moist. Ended up baking for 50 minutes so that the top tots were golden. Wonderful comfort food. Next time I might add a layer of green beens or other veggie to make it a bit more healthy. Thanks

I have no frame of reference for this dish, seeing as I have neither eaten one nor made one before. I really liked it. I did add extra cheese to the soup mixture (I wanted to make sure that the tots browned up nicely so I used the "top" cheese in the sauce) and I threw in a layer of corn (extra vegetable). The family enjoyed it. I will definitely make it again. I might throw a few extra tots in for the bottom layer next time.

I loved this! I am preserving fresh onion for other meals (pandemic cooking) so I crushed up a handful of crispy onion to put on top of the ground beer. I also drained 1 can of carrots & peas and tossed it in after it was done in the oven. A few tosses with the wooden spoon and the veggies were warm too.
This was amazing! Recipe says Montreal steak seasoning is optional, but it is a must! It really tied in all the flavors perfectly.
Soooo good as is. Change nothing
As good as making it first time. I made this 9 months ago. There are many dishes one can make more than once in a lifetime. This is one of them. Stay true to the recipe, you won't go wrong.
THIS TATOR TOT CASSEROLE IS THE BOMB.com!
I would make it again sometime. It wasn't how I remembered it as a kid.

Wicked good! Only changes I made: substitute the 1/2 cup milk with 1/4 cup half and half (just because that’s what I had on hand), mix meat and soup mixture rather than layer, and sprinkle with scallions. #covidcarbcrazy ??
New family fav!
Wonderful texture and flavor!
Very Good! We did add a layer of french cut green beans, plus used a steak sauce in place of the Montreal Steak seasoning.
delish! i make it as often as i can

Made this and the family totally destroyed it. I found it to be kinda like a variation of shepherds pie, probably because I added peas and carrots to it. Seeing how it had meat and potatoes I had to add a vegetable so it was an all in one complete meal. Definitely will be making again, was a hit.
Everyone loved it I added green beans
It was good, but nothing to rave about. I would make it again, but with some additions. Maybe some bacon, extra cream ofs, more seasoning.
A new family favorite

For maybe the first time ever, I made a recipe exactly as written..... Well, I did add some fresh parsley to the seasonings.... But that hardly counts. Either way, this is an excellent dish as written and will take modifications like fresh mushrooms or green beans easily. I don't understand the negative reviews, at all. They either didn't follow the recipe (as many admitted, they used substitute seasoning) or they simply have a mouth full of faulty taste buds. Easy and delicious and the Mister went back for thirds! Thanks!
Please brown and seasoning your beef first!
This is a great recipe. My 3 boys loved it. It was easy and delicious. I followed the recipe as stated. Will make it again.
This was delicious! I used 2 lbs of burger, not 1, because I have a big family. I added 1 can nacho cheese soup in addition to the cream of mushroom.
I followed the recipe the only thing I changed was A1 sauce for steak seasoning. It’s delicious reminds me of hash brown casserole. I also added a tablespoon of sour cream.

I didn't add the onions once I started cooking the meat and added them in when I added the Worcestershire sauce and cooked the meat a little longer with the sauce and seasonings. I substituted seasoned meat tenderizer for the steak seasoning
I made it as recipe called. Turned out great. Even my very picky mother in law liked it.
Definitely make again

Love it. Only thing I did different was put in all the cheese and all the Worcestershire sauce together instead of splitting it like the instructions said. It turned out just fine without splitting the Worcestershire sauce into two different parts and the cheese too. Mix it all up less fuss and going back to direction over and over.
Easy and yummy!?? What more can you say??
husband loves it.

This is my favorite recipe I've made in ages. I try new recipes all the time (mostly from Allrecipes), but rarely do I rate them
but this one I had to. I followed the recipe exactly, changing
nothing. I can't wait to make it again the same way. Perfect

This is a classic. The Montreal Seasoning and worchester add a great flavor. I omit the black pepper because I feel there is enough pepper in the Montreal Seasoning. The best part is the crunchy tator tot crust on the bottom. Mmmmm!
The only changes I made were to add more seasoning. We like our food spicy. It is good, quick and easy. Will definitely make it again
I have been playing with cooking, as it’s new for me. I’ve made dishes with ribeye, shrimp, and salmon and this is the one my husband raved about the most! Lol
Great! The whole family loved it. It will definitely be something we make in the future.
The kids love this and ask for it. The 15 year old now makes it for herself if I just chop the onion.

The family LOVED it! I added a package of sliced mushrooms and cooked it with the meat mixture. Also, I just mixed the soup mixture with the meat mixture instead of layering it. I used 96/4 ground beef and 98% fat free condensed mushroom soup only because I'm cooking healthier, which worked out great! I will definitely be making this again-yum! Thanks for sharing
I use 2 cans of cream soup. Family loves this.
very good
I put more cheese and I didn’t have the steak seasoning so I eliminated it
I left it as is and I absolutely loved it!! Will be making again!
Added extra hamburger and extra cheese. Boyfriend loved it! I’ll be making this again!!
This was fantastic!

This is SO freakin good! I’m not one for tater tot casserole but my husband loves stuff like this. He said it was a hit out of the ballpark?? yes, he’s lame but I’ve made this twice already and the second time I added more hamburger and an extra can of condensed mushroom soup.

I was looking through all of the tater tot casserole recipes and came across this one. It was different from all the others and I decided to give it a try. It is very flavorful and delicious! I added more tater tots to the bottom of the dish (probably 30-33 tots). I also added more cheddar cheese on top. I used an 8 oz block for the whole recipe. 1/2 cup in the meat mixture and the rest on top 15 minutes before the dish was done. The steak seasoning made it really tasty. This recipe is a keeper!
Going to make it again.

EVERYONE loved it, and for a picky family, that says a lot! The only thing I changed was the amount of tots that I placed on the bottom (about 35), and then plenty on top to cover the dish. Other than that, I followed the recipe as written. A keeper for sure!

I did add Worchestershire & more ketchup.
Was yummy.
I used Kroger tater rounds and Colby jack cheese and it worked just fine.
Followed the recipe. Next time will use about 30 tator tots in bottom and add some green beans to the soup mixture. Granddaughter gobbled it up!

20 smashed tater tots is insufficient amount to cover the bottom of the 13x9 dish called for in the recipe. As a result the 800 g bag of tater tots I purchased, was insufficient to cover the top of the casserole sufficiently. (In Canada food is sold in grams not ounces so I have no idea if the bags are the same size). Also, I would recommend heating the mushroom soup mixture slightly to make it easier to "pour" over the beef mixture. And, I added mixed vegetables to the beef mixture to make it a more rounded meal. 

I would make this again, making certain to buy enough tater tots to get the desired coverage.

I love this recipe because everything in it is always available in my kitchen and it's an easy pleaser. I've made it several times and it tastes yummy as written. I've also left out the onions (since they sometimes don't agree with me) and it still tasted great. I serve it on a plate with some mixed veggies and it's a great meal. The other thing I've done is substitute the ground beef with breakfast sausage and added sausage pan gravy instead of mushroom soup & milk, which makes a great brunch casserole to serve with eggs.
I was asked to make it again before we had finished eating dinner!

Very delicious casserole. Decided it needed 2 cans of soup to add more moisture. Used cream of mushroom and cream of celery. Great combination. Also, added some green beans. great flavor and added texture. Tater tots on bottom of dish was a great idea. I doubled the amount in the recipe to cover a 13x9. probably 1/3 of the 30 oz bag.
It was very delicious. I didn't have tatortots so I shredded potatoes and it came out great

Being from MN, where the Tater Tot Hotdish (Non-Minnesotans call it Casserole) was invented. I have slight problem with this Recipe, My Mom, and all my Friends here, We put frozen or fresh Veggies in this Recipe. Some just do Corn, but most of Us put a bag of frozen Mixed Veggies in this. Oh! Also some of Us either Do Cream of Chicken and Cream of Mushroom, or some Friends do just Cream of Chicken and No Cream of Mushroom.
I Love Tater Tot Hotdish (Non Minnesotans call it Casserole), been making it forever, and My Mom made this Several times when I was growing up
I made whilecon vacation and everyone loved it!!!
Didn’t have cream of mushroom so I swapped it out with Alfredo sauce.. kids and husband loved it! Ended up turning the heat up on the oven and broiling at the end as well.
Really like this recipe. Easy, but has a bit of a twist from the tater tot casseroles that I've had before.

I used cream of chicken instead and had mini tots so I used way more than 20 for the bottom. Also I'm a cheese lover so the top got....3 lbs...of...cheese... It wasnt soupy like others are saying. KEEP THE SPICES you will NOT regret it. As for cooking, it was in for 34 minutes and was done perfectly.
Easy to prepare and everyone loved it!
I added frozen sweet corn and green peas on top of the meat layer. Added another great layer of flavor and texture. Family fave!!!

I substituted Grilled London Broil with Montreal Steak Seasoniong for the meat and added 1 Tbsp Yellow Curry. It was fantastic! There are a lot of options to dress this up - next time I'm thinking maybe fajita seasoned skirt steak and some peppers.
